alert.note: Alert for Comanche; Cooke; Eastland; Erath; Hood; Jack; Montague; Palo Pinto; Parker; Somervell; Stephens; Wise; Young (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 12 at 7:17PM CDT until March 13 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Likely Sunday... .Low relative humidity values and gusty winds will develop tomorrow afternoon within an area of dry, dormant grasses. There will be a threat for rapidly spreading wildfires Sunday afternoon and early evening across western North Texas. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM CDT SUNDAY FOR BREEZY WINDS... LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY... AND DRY FUELS FOR WESTERN NORTH TEXAS... The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a Red Flag Warning for critical fire weather conditions which is in effect from noon to 9 PM CDT Sunday. * TIMING...Noon Sunday through Sunday evening. * WINDS...South 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 10 to 15 percent. * TEMPERATURES...Upper 60s and lower 70s. * IMPACTS...Any fires that do develop will spread rapidly and difficult to contain.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that extreme fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and dry vegetation can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Avoid all outside burning and welding today. Do not toss lit cigarette butts outside. Report wild fires to the nearest fire department or law enforcement office.
